qas.question: Who built the first Colossus in 1943?
When was the Colossus sent to Bletchley Park?
Who achieved success at cracking secret German military communications during World War II?
Where did the British crack secret German military communications during World War II?

context: During World War II<a2_0>, the British<a2_0/> at <a3_0>Bletchley Park<a3_0/> achieved a number of successes at breaking encrypted German military communications. The German encryption machine, Enigma, was first attacked with the help of the electro-mechanical bombes. To crack the more sophisticated German Lorenz SZ 40/42 machine, used for high-level Army communications, Max Newman and his colleagues commissioned <a0_0>Flowers<a0_0/> to build the Colossus. He spent eleven months from early February 1943 designing and building the first Colossus. After a functional test in December 1943, Colossus was shipped to Bletchley Park, where it was delivered on <a1_0>18 January 1944<a1_0/> and attacked its first message on 5 February.
